entry.title: Concern about "Inscriptions". (Keagan McClelland)
entry.summary: The concern raised in the context is regarding a proposal to price space in the UTXO (Unspent Transaction Output) set. The author expresses worry that this proposal could limit users' ability to manage UTXOs effectively and may lead to doxing and privacy issues. One of the main costs associated with having numerous UTXOs is the fees linked to spending low-valued UTXOs.The author highlights the open question of whether there should be a mechanism to determine the price of space in the UTXO set. They argue that the lack of pricing makes it difficult to distinguish between legitimate transactions and spam. The UTXO set, unlike main block and witness data, must be maintained by all nodes, including pruned nodes. This implies that UTXO set space is a significant resource and possibly even more important than chain space.The author suggests that pricing UTXOs based on resource costs might eliminate unnecessary usage of inscriptions. However, they acknowledge that such a mechanism would require users to pay "rent" for their Bitcoin accounts, which could be offensive to a substantial portion of the Bitcoin user base.The context also includes additional information about the sender, Einherjar, who used Proton Mail secure email and shared their public key for secure communication. The attachments included in the email are a PGP key and a digital signature.Overall, the concern expressed in the context relates to the potential consequences of pricing space in the UTXO set, including limitations on UTXO management and concerns about privacy. The author also discusses the significance of the UTXO set as a resource and raises the possibility of using pricing to reduce unnecessary usage.
